segments.text: I see the boy standing on that stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His stool is wobbling, and I can’t believe he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl standing next to him, waiting for her share with such innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman at the sink has no idea what’s happening right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she’s just standing there, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the way the water is pooling around her feet, and I just know someone is going to slip soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will fall before the woman notices the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a mix of chaos and innocence, and it’s almost too much to take in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t hurt himself when that stool finally tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so focused on the cookies that she doesn’t even notice the danger around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
